item.title: Law of Weird Computer Commands
item.description: The “Law” of Weird Computer Commands: Any time a computer command seems weird, it’s a path dependent consequence of keyboards not being standardised until the mid-1990s. For example, Vim/Vi is the “ubiquitous text editor”, especially for anyone working with Linux based servers. Just as ubiquitous, are the jokes about how difficult it is to exit Vim (here is a flow chart if your interested). You have to use the ESC key constantly, which is inconvenient for people with small hands on most keyboards and a real pain when Apple made the ESC a virtual button on the Touch Bar.
